chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order
Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua D Burkhardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall report to Probation by 4:00 PM 10-25-22.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim.

The defendant shall sign releases authorizing all treatment providers to access any and all collateral sources and authorizing the treatment providers to provide periodic progress reports to the agent and to the court. The release shall authorize each treatment provider to discuss the defendant's treatment with the agent and any other treatment providers
Any treatment provider will provide progress reports to the court and will fully disclose any failures of the defendant to attend sessions, failure to fully engage in treatment, dishonesty, and any other failures of the defendant to cooperate or fully participate in the treatment,
The def shall be periodically and randomly tested for drugs and to monitor compliance with any prescribed medications. Positive test results for illegal drugs or alcohol shall be reported to the agent and substance abuse treatment providers
If medications are prescribed, the defendant will be ordered to take all medications as prescribed and the plan will explain in detail how the administration of the drugs will be monitored to insure compliance with the medication orders
Court also includes sanctions for the following violations:
For any failure to sign releases-jail until documents signed
Any missed appts w/o valid excuse-10 days jail

Shall submit a DNA sample. 
All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

records.addlTxt:
1:00 PM (21CF111/21CF341/21CF407/22CF31) Defendant Joshua D Burkhardt in court, in custody.  Attorney Alyssa F. George-Stifler in court for Joshua D Burkhardt.  Attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights compliance has been met. Atty George-Stifler filed a sentencing memorandum on 10-21-discussion held; jail credit slip discussion held; Atty George-Stifler heard on sentence credit; 1:02 PM brief recess for parties to discuss sentence credit; 1:07 PM reconvene-appearances remain the same. Parties heard and stipulate on time served; discussion held on victim impact statement; Court heard; parties gives sentencing arguments; def makes statement.

Court heard and imposes the following sentence:
As to 21CF341, count 3--IMPOSED AND STAYED--9 months DCJ w/ h&t
As to 21CF341, count 4--IMPOSED AND STAYED--9 months DCJ w/ h&t
Sentence credit as follows:
21CF341--6 days
21CF407--309 days
22CF31--231 days (served within the 309 days in case 21CF407)
Total of 315 days sentence credit awarded 

As to all other cases/counts being addressed:
Sentence withheld
Probation for a length of 3 years with the following conditions:
No contact with the victim
The defendant shall sign releases authorizing all treatment providers to access any and all collateral sources and authorizing the treatment providers to provide periodic progress reports to the agent and to the court. The release shall authorize each treatment provider to discuss the defendant's treatment with the agent and any other treatment providers
Any treatment provider will provide progress reports to the court and will fully disclose any failures of the defendant to attend sessions, failure to fully engage in treatment, dishonesty, and any other failures of the defendant to cooperate or fully participate in the treatment,
The def shall be periodically and randomly tested for drugs and to monitor compliance with any prescribed medications. Positive test results for illegal drugs or alcohol shall be reported to the agent and substance abuse treatment providers.
If medications are prescribed, the defendant will be ordered to take all medications as prescribed and the plan will explain in detail how the administration of the drugs will be monitored to insure compliance with the medication orders. 
Court costs
DNA + costs
Court also includes sanctions for the following violations:
For any failure to sign releases-jail until documents signed
Any missed appts w/o valid excuse-10 days jail
Report to Probation by 4:00 p.m. on 10-25-22
Sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:00 AM 21CF111/21CF341/21CF407/22CF31/ (& 22DD341/22JU0302 as uncharged read ins) Defendant Joshua D Burkhardt in court, in custody.  Attorney Alyssa F. George-Stifler in court for Joshua D Burkhardt.  Attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim compliance has been met. Court reviews plea questionnaire/waiver of rights, charges and penalties. Case 21CF111 count 2 is amended to misdemeanor disorderly conduct/domestic. Defendant enters a plea of no contest to count 2 in case 21CF111; counts 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8 in case 21CF341; counts 1, 3 in case 21CF407 and counts 1, 3, 6 in case 22CF31. Court makes findings, accepts pleas, enters a judgment of conviction and finds defendant guilty. Count 1 in case 21CF111 is dismissed. All other counts in cases 21CF341, 21CF407 and 22CF31 are DRI. Victim witness coordinator reads statement from victim. Sentencing hearing to be scheduled.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:29 PM w/ cases 21CF341, 21CF111 and 21CF407.  Defendant Joshua D Burkhardt in court, in custody.  Attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alyssa F. George in court for Joshua D Burkhardt. Victim Rights Compliant. Attorney Tienstra makes statement to the court. Asking to have 22CF31 run with other outstanding cases. There are issues at this time with discovery. Attorney George concurs. Set for a TSC in about 30 days to see if progress has been made.
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order on Arraignment - signed by Br. 4

8:31 AM Defendant Joshua D Burkhardt in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Barrington in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alyssa F. George in court for Joshua D Burkhardt. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim or her residence;  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

10:34 AM Defendant Joshua D Burkhardt in court, in custody.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for SPD and they should be appointing; Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within/waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $2000 CASH bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim or her residence;  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Review hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
